title: Authors and Citation
text: Dubey Y (2025). “ploswater: Data Publications PLOS Water Journal.” doi:10.5281/zenodo.14616993, https://github.com/openwashdata/ploswater.
code: @Misc{dubey:2025,   title = {ploswater: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal},   author = {Yash Dubey},   year = {2025},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.14616993},   url = {https://github.com/openwashdata/ploswater},   abstract = {Provides access to publishing trends from PLOS Water Journal.},   version = {0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal
title: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal
text: goal ploswater make available data publication trends PLOS Water Journal.

title: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal
text: can install development version ploswater GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table . Click Download CSV. window opens displays CSV browser. Right-click anywhere inside window select “Save Page …”. Save file folder choice.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/ploswater") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra)

title: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal
text: package provides access data publications PLOS Water Journal. data includes information publication types, SDGs targeted, authors, institutions, .

title: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal
text: dataset ploswater contains data … 240 observations 1506 variables overview variable names, see following table.
code: ploswater |>    select(1:10) |>  # Select first 10 columns   head(3) |>    gt::gt() |>   gt::as_raw_html()

title: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal
code: library(ploswater) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate)  # Convert publication_date to Date type ploswater$publication_date <- as.Date(ploswater$publication_date)  # Create year-month column and count publications monthly_counts <- ploswater %>%   mutate(publication_month = floor_date(publication_date, "month")) %>%   count(publication_month) %>%   arrange(publication_month)  # Create bar chart ggplot(monthly_counts, aes(x = publication_month, y = n)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "steelblue") +   labs(x = "",        y = "Number of Publications",        title = "Number of Publications per Month") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "3 month",                 date_labels = "%b %Y") # Create citation impact visualization ggplot(ploswater, aes(x = publication_date, y = cited_by_count)) +   geom_point(aes(size = fwci), alpha = 0.6) +   scale_size_continuous(name = "Field-Weighted\nCitation Impact") +   labs(x = "Publication Date",        y = "Number of Citations",        title = "Citation Impact Over Time") +   theme_minimal() library(gt)  # Compute summary statistics summary_stats <- data.frame(   Statistic = c(     "Mean Citations",     "Median Citations",     "Mean FWCI",     "Total Publications",     "Correlation: Citations & FWCI"   ),   Value = c(     mean(ploswater$cited_by_count, na.rm = TRUE),     median(ploswater$cited_by_count, na.rm = TRUE),     mean(ploswater$fwci, na.rm = TRUE),     round(nrow(ploswater), 0),     cor(ploswater$cited_by_count, ploswater$fwci, use = "complete.obs")   ) )  # Create and print the table using gt summary_stats %>%   gt() %>%   tab_header(     title = "Summary Statistics"   )

title: Data on Publications in PLOS Water Journal

what: ploswater: A dataset of papers from PLOS Water journal — ploswater
title: ploswater: A dataset of papers from PLOS Water journal — ploswater
text: dataset includes data papers published PLOS Water journal. raw data obtained using OpenAlex API. data includes details publication, references, authorship, institutions.

title: ploswater: A dataset of papers from PLOS Water journal — ploswater
ploswater: A dataset of papers from PLOS Water journal — ploswater
text: tibble 240 rows 1506 variables id Unique Identifier doi DOI study title Title study display_name Displayed Name OpenAlex publication_year Year publication publication_date Date publication language Original publication language type Indicates type scholarly work type_crossref work type specified Crossref indexed_in  authorships Contains detailed information authors institutional affiliations institution_assertions Information institutional affiliations countries_distinct_count Total number unique country codes among work's authorships institutions_distinct_count Total number unique institutions among work's authorships corresponding_author_ids List OpenAlex IDs corresponding authors corresponding_institution_ids List OpenAlex IDs institutions corresponding authors fwci Field-weighted Citation Impact, calculated ratio citations received citations expected publication year three following years has_fulltext Boolean indicating full text searchable OpenAlex fulltext_origin Indicates full text obtained (e.g., "pdf" "ngrams") has_fulltext true cited_by_count Number times work cited is_retracted Wether study retracted is_paratext  topics  keywords Keywords text concepts Key concepts text mesh  locations_count Number different places work can found locations List places work exists, including journals, proceedings, repositories (like arXiv), institutional repositories sustainable_development_goals Classifications linking work UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) grants Information research funding grants associated work datasets Associated research datasets versions Different versions work available across locations (e.g., peer-reviewed published version, preprint version) referenced_works_count Number works work cites referenced_works List works cited work related_works Works related one cited_by_api_url URL access list works citing work counts_by_year Year--year breakdown citation counts, excluding citations older ten years updated_date ISO 8601 date string showing record last modified created_date ISO 8601 date string indicating work first added OpenAlex ids.openalex primary identifier OpenAlex ids.doi Digital
